examples: When you're out, they moan because you're not there.
You guys should just stop moaning and get a life!
When you're in the house your parents moan about you being under their feet.
Ladies, don't moan.
Darth Vader doesn't moan.
words.defineEn: to make a low sound that often expresses pain, grief, or disappointment
words.defineVi: để làm cho một âm thanh thấp mà thường diễn tả nỗi đau, đau buồn, hoặc thất vọng

examples: She groaned and held her head.
On his return, when Pete saw the pile of files on his desk, he groaned inwardly.
Enter the groans and rolled eyes of teenagedom.
But after a few hours, their roof groans under the weight of volcanic debris, and they realize they can't stay.
ANNA HEILMAN: I heard this collective groan, and I knew what happened.
words.defineEn: to make a deep, low sound, typically expressing pain, despair, or disapproval
words.defineVi: để tạo ra một âm thanh trầm, thấp, thường thể hiện sự đau đớn, tuyệt vọng hoặc không tán thành

examples: AMNA NAWAZ: Devastation across the South this morning, downed power lines, gutted forests, and homes eviscerated, the aftermath of a series of powerful tornadoes that wreaked havoc last night, including in Georgia.
words.defineEn: experiencing great sadness, shock, or disappointment
words.defineVi: trải qua nỗi buồn, cú sốc hoặc sự thất vọng lớn

examples: The superintendent believed Lancaster's story.
I believed his lies for years.
Scientists believe that a major breakthrough is on the horizon.
Many sports pundits believe the vultures are circling for the team's beleaguered head coach.
His opponents believe he is definitely on the run.
words.defineEn: to accept something to be true even without proof
words.defineVi: để chấp nhận một cái gì đó là sự thật ngay cả khi không có bằng chứng

words.defineEn: to be understandable, reasonable, or logical
words.defineVi: để được hiểu, hợp lý, hoặc hợp lý

examples: That contest wasn't fair!
The food was fair to middling.
Everyone should have a fair slice of the cake.
All of his teachers are going bananas over his science fair experiment.
They were fair people before it went to their heads.
words.defineEn: treating everyone equally and in a right or acceptable way
words.defineVi: đối xử bình đẳng với mọi người và theo cách đúng đắn hoặc có thể chấp nhận được

words.defineEn: an activity or situation that does not produce any benefit or value, and instead consumes time and resources that could be better utilized elsewhere
words.defineVi: một hoạt động hoặc tình huống không tạo ra bất kỳ lợi ích hoặc giá trị nào và thay vào đó tiêu tốn thời gian và tài nguyên có thể được sử dụng tốt hơn ở nơi khác

words.defineEn: to stop being harsh or strict with someone
words.defineVi: để ngừng khắc nghiệt hoặc nghiêm khắc với ai đó

examples: They rejected negotiations out of hand.
The situation is already out of hand as it is.
Moving to London is certainly a possibility - I wouldn't dismiss it out of hand.
Now, nature-inspired algorithms can get a bit out of hand.
And then Republicans immediately dismissed that out of hand.
words.defineEn: impossible or very hard to control
words.defineVi: không thể hoặc rất khó để kiểm soát

examples: The report names and shames companies that are not doing enough to fight industrial pollution.
Pardon my French, but that's a damned shame!
The teacher encouraged their students to tell the truth and shame the devil, even if it meant admitting to cheating or plagiarism.
Look, I'm just as upset as anyone, but I'm not willing to take part in some name and shame against everyone in the neighborhood!
The time limit is shame.
words.defineEn: an uneasy feeling that we get because of our own or someone else's mistake or bad manner
words.defineVi: một cảm giác khó chịu mà chúng ta có được do sai lầm hoặc cách cư xử tồi tệ của chính mình hoặc của người khác

examples: Interrupting others is annoying, so try to break the habit.
Interrupting others is annoying, so try to break the habit.
However, too much of a good thing can get annoying.
We finally got rid of your younger brother, he's so annoying!
Lines are super annoying.
words.defineVi: gây ra sự tức giận nhẹ

words.defineEn: to feel regret or disappointment in oneself for a past mistake or missed opportunity
words.defineVi: cảm thấy hối tiếc hoặc thất vọng về bản thân vì một sai lầm trong quá khứ hoặc cơ hội bị bỏ lỡ

words.phonetic: təbi slæʃ ɡoʊ slæʃ ɡɛt bᵻjɔnd ɐ dʒoʊk
words.defineEn: to start becoming a source of trouble or worry
words.defineVi: để bắt đầu trở thành một nguồn rắc rối hoặc lo lắng
